data.title: Denmark and the euro
data.meta_description: Denmark joined the European Union in 1973. It has negotiated an opt-out from the euro and is thus not obliged to introduce it.
data.text:
Status

Denmark has not introduced the euro. The EU Treaty gives Denmark the right to remain outside the euro area, even when all convergence criteria are met (opt-out).

The Danish krone joined the Exchange Rate Mechanism II (ERM II) on 1 January 1999 and observes a central rate of 7,46038 to the euro with narrow fluctuation margins of Â±2.25%.

Exchange rate

The current euro to Danish krone foreign exchange reference rate can be consulted on the website of the European Central Bank (updated daily).
